item.title: Ticket #266 (WP sidebar inKonqueror 3.3 will reload in page instead of sidebar) created
item.dc:creator: steamedpenguin
item.description:
Add the WP sidebar to Konqueror 3.3 and post a message, the posting will work, but the posting notification will go into the page instead of the sidebar where it is supposed to be.

Filing bug here for tracking purposes. Bug could be a Konqueror bug.

item.description: I've added a comment about this to an existant (but closed) bug over at php.net ​http://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=23525

item.title: Ticket #209 (Subject line of sent e-mails is not UTF-8) updated
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description: Note that bug 263 contains a workaround for a PHP bug which will need applying to the patch for this bug.

item.title: Ticket #263 (Email Notification headers wrong) created
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description:
When WP sends out an email (to notify a post author of a comment, or a moderator of a comment for moderation), it adds in the MIME version of the message, a from address, and the content encoding headers. However PHP seems to munge the newlines and you get an extra new line after the mime type header. This blank line ends the headers and starts the mail body.

This means that some software (like gmail) cannot decode the from address (or presumably the content encoding).

It seems to be a bug in PHP in that any 'unknown' header seems to get an extra newline. and 'MIME-Version' seems to be unknown to PHP

A work around is to move the 'MIME-Version' header to be the last of the added headers.

item.title: Changeset [1615]: Apache 1.3 does not support the reluctant (non-greedy) expression ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Apache 1.3 does not support the reluctant (non-greedy) expression modifier. Remove the modifier when outputting mod_rewrite rules.

item.title: Ticket #262 (Comment moderation always matches with spam word trailing newline) updated
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description: Just spotted this has been resolved by Dougal in cvs. Sorry for the noise. Can be resolved

item.title: Ticket #262 (Comment moderation always matches with spam word trailing newline) created
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description: If your list of spam words (in options -> discussion -> comment moderation -> spam words) has newline after the last word, the method check_comment() always matches. That is it thinks every comment contains a spam word.

item.title: Ticket #261 (Re-selecting default ping and comment status) created
item.dc:creator: Beel
item.description:
Once deselected, there is no ability to turn them back on. I added this to options.php: if( in_array($option->option_name, $nonbools) && $new_val == 1 ) $new_val = 'open';

if ($new_val !== $old_val)

$result = $wpdb->query("UPDATE $wpdb->options SET option_value = '$new_val' WHERE option_name = '$option->option_name'");
